main event: On January 10, 1948, a female civilian observed an ovalular-tear drop object in the sky over Wildwood, N.J., which split into two pieces.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 5-8 seconds., The colors reported were yellow, red, or amber., The object was noted to be moving slowly., There were no reports of other witnesses from local authorities like the police and Coast Guard., The object maneuvered by splitting into two pieces during observation.
witness description: female civilian, age not specified, reported the observation to authorities.
